instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> problems
threads.message:
Hi

Can any confirm if the <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> on the above board has firmware. I have 2 identical board here with the same problem no internal image/backlight and I purchased from AliExpress 5 x CBTL06142EEE and it still not working. I've read mix posts on different forums about it having firmware.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> problems
threads.message:
For older models, Analog Mux is not firmware dependant.
I cannot confirm that for T2 platforms, but seems to be the same chip.
Be aware with chinese "new" chips; could be refurbished, sanded/polished and remarked, look like new.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> problems
